lead_paragraph: The appointments of the son and brother of Mullah Muhammad Omar, the Taliban founder, come at a time of rising criticism and the threat of outright rebellion from field commanders.

byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan. Farooq Jan Mangal contributed reporting from Khost, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and TAIMOOR SHAH

headline.print_headline: Taliban Leader, Trying to End Infighting, Appoints Critics to Senior Posts
headline.main: Taliban Leader, Trying to End Infighting, Appoints Critics to Senior Posts

snippet: The appointments of the son and brother of Mullah Muhammad Omar, the Taliban founder, come at a time of rising criticism and the threat of outright rebellion from field commanders.
abstract: Taliban commander Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour appoints Mullah Abdul Manan and Mullah Muhammad Yaqoub, brother and son of group's founder Mullah Muhammad Omar, in effort to unite clashing factions and consolidate power.
